cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest, expected to accelerate toward the central Texas coast and then stall inland while slowly drifting north-northwest toward eastern Texas / southwest Louisiana by day-5
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (between Port Mansfield and Port O'Connor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: North of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, TX; Tropical-Storm Watch: Boca de Catan, MX to Port Mansfield, TX and north of San Luis Pass to High Island, TX; Storm-Surge Watch: Port Mansfield to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (warnings expected Thursday for portions of Texas coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island with expanding impacts into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (no surge watch for LA coast yet)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤21% chance of ≥34-kt winds; ≤3% chance of ≥50-kt winds). Periods of gusty easterly winds possible late Friday through Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Any surge impacts expected to remain west of Lake Charles; minor water level rises possible in Calcasieu Pass if the storm drifts east later in the period.
weather_observation.rainfall: Harvey could deliver 10–15 inches with locally higher totals across southwest Louisiana beginning Friday, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Extended duration of heavy rain may disrupt port access roads and rail corridors; inland river flooding along Calcasieu River possible early next week.
